intro: Curarea tecunarum, commonly known as the arrow poison plant, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains potent neurotoxic compounds. The plant's leaves are typically heart-shaped and its flowers are small and yellow-green in color. The toxins in Curarea tecunarum have been historically used by indigenous peoples for hunting and warfare. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a dangerous plant and requires careful handling.
